text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bosnia's municipal elections in June 1997 and return of refugees will determine future of Bosnia within the next year, newspaper editorial says.

- Canada backs U.S. stance that bringing indicted war criminals to tribunal in The Hague is a priority for the next year, paper comments. Mirza Hajric, political adviser to Moslem president Alija Izetbegovic, says international community is going to address war crimes issue to prevent further obstruction of peace process.

- Sead Avdic, vice-president of opposition Social Democratic Party, says because opposition's political programme is not clearly distinguished from the ruling party's policies, it is too early to discuss creating shadow governement.
